trait.name: OCB status in MS patients
trait.description: Oligoclonal bands are bands of immunoglobulins that are seen when a patient's blood serum, gained from blood plasma, or cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is analyzed. Many conditions can cause OCB to appear in the spinal fluid or blood serum, including inflammation and infection. Patients with Multiple Scheloris often have OCB, and this study looks at the association between OCB and the SNP studied. Having this SNP does not mean you are more or less likely to get MS. It is only relevant to doctors diagnosing those who already have MS.
